blog.description:
Game of Thrones/A Song of Ice and Fire Art Blog, None of these are original works.  If you re-blog from here, keep the artist's credits within your re-blog! Background and Avatar by the excellent Prokrik.

Spoilers in some pictures! Be wary, I'm not responsible for your discoveries!

Use the home link, or the orange top right X to navigate back home. 

Use the search or the image tags to find your favorite houses/characters. "HLS4" for histories and lore of season 4.

summary:
*COULD BE CONSIDERED SPOILER* 
TURN BACK NOW 
Ok, so we know that Sophie kept a scroll from GOT. It was given to her on the last...
body:
Sansa’s Scroll

*COULD BE CONSIDERED SPOILER*

TURN BACK NOW

Ok, so we know that Sophie kept a scroll from GOT. It was given to her on the last day of shooting and it’s from SEASON 8 and it’s a MAJOR SPOILER.

So, what are we thinking is on the scroll?

I’m kind of hoping it’s not a “hey, I used the GC to kidnap Sansa, come bend the knee, Love Hate, Cersei” scroll.

What else could it be?

A secret letter from Jon, warning Sansa of his plan before his arrival?

Wedding invite scroll? 😂

Thoughts?

summary: The kind of elitist Stark fans who call Sansa ungrateful, stupid, and selfish for wanting more than her sheltered life in a...
body:
The kind of elitist Stark fans who call Sansa ungrateful, stupid, and selfish for wanting more than her sheltered life in a dreary landscape who is mostly thought of as silly by her family (and outright bullied in the show) sound suspiciously similar to those types of abusive parents- “You’ve got food on your table and shoes on your feet. You go to a good school and have so many toys. Show some gratitude!” whenever the abused kid is showing lip by wanting more. You have the basics. I could be beating you bloody, but I’m not. How dare you feel entitled to more than that? It’s the same with these fans. Sansa had a big family, food, shelter, an occasional singer. She was wrong to want some excitement and to grow up.

WF was definitely not a bad place to raise kids, but there was absolutely nothing wrong with Sansa wanting an adventure, to see more of the world she’d read about and finally meet people who don’t think her hobbies are stupid. Who wouldn’t want that, especially at her age?

reblog.comment:
The kind of elitist Stark fans who call Sansa ungrateful, stupid, and selfish for wanting more than her sheltered life in a dreary landscape who is mostly thought of as silly by her family (and outright bullied in the show) sound suspiciously similar to those types of abusive parents- “You’ve got food on your table and shoes on your feet. You go to a good school and have so many toys. Show some gratitude!” whenever the abused kid is showing lip by wanting more. You have the basics. I could be beating you bloody, but I’m not. How dare you feel entitled to more than that? It’s the same with these fans. Sansa had a big family, food, shelter, an occasional singer. She was wrong to want some excitement and to grow up.

WF was definitely not a bad place to raise kids, but there was absolutely nothing wrong with Sansa wanting an adventure, to see more of the world she’d read about and finally meet people who don’t think her hobbies are stupid. Who wouldn’t want that, especially at her age?

trail.content_raw:
The kind of elitist Stark fans who call Sansa ungrateful, stupid, and selfish for wanting more than her sheltered life in a dreary landscape who is mostly thought of as silly by her family (and outright bullied in the show) sound suspiciously similar to those types of abusive parents- “You’ve got food on your table and shoes on your feet. You go to a good school and have so many toys. Show some gratitude!” whenever the abused kid is showing lip by wanting more. You have the basics. I could be beating you bloody, but I’m not. How dare you feel entitled to more than that? It’s the same with these fans. Sansa had a big family, food, shelter, an occasional singer. She was wrong to want some excitement and to grow up.

WF was definitely not a bad place to raise kids, but there was absolutely nothing wrong with Sansa wanting an adventure, to see more of the world she’d read about and finally meet people who don’t think her hobbies are stupid. Who wouldn’t want that, especially at her age?
trail.content:
The kind of elitist Stark fans who call Sansa ungrateful, stupid, and selfish for wanting more than her sheltered life in a dreary landscape who is mostly thought of as silly by her family (and outright bullied in the show) sound suspiciously similar to those types of abusive parents- “You’ve got food on your table and shoes on your feet. You go to a good school and have so many toys. Show some gratitude!” whenever the abused kid is showing lip by wanting more. You have the basics. I could be beating you bloody, but I’m not. How dare you feel entitled to more than that? It’s the same with these fans. Sansa had a big family, food, shelter, an occasional singer. She was wrong to want some excitement and to grow up.

WF was definitely not a bad place to raise kids, but there was absolutely nothing wrong with Sansa wanting an adventure, to see more of the world she’d read about and finally meet people who don’t think her hobbies are stupid. Who wouldn’t want that, especially at her age?

summary: Hi, one of my most favorite Sansan fics is “Gone North to Die by Wandering_gypsy_feet. Do you have a list of post season 7 fics...
question: Hi, one of my most favorite Sansan fics is “Gone North to Die by Wandering_gypsy_feet. Do you have a list of post season 7 fics where they reunite in winterfell? Thank you so much!
answer:
Enemy at the Gates 

Remembrances

Only One

I Am No Knight

Not Afraid

Callousness and Kindliness

Holiest thing I know

Forever and Never

As My Lady Commands

If It Kills Me

In The Flames

Kissed By Fire  and  A Song of Springtime

Cold Fire

Setting the Fire by SanSanFanFan

The Journey

The Gift of Mercy

Game of Thrones Season 8

Das Geschenk by DavidbeatsGoliath  - in German

The wolves of winter - Teil I - in German

The Heart of the North

Auburn like Flames

Hateful Things

He Won’t Hurt Her

And the Birds sing no more

Loyalty of Hounds

summary:
I read a theory recently where people believe that Jaime will die protecting Dany as a redemption for killing her father.
Oh my...
body:
I read a theory recently where people believe that Jaime will die protecting Dany as a redemption for killing her father.

Oh my sweet summer child. Watch the scene again where he explains to Brienne what happened that night and there is no way he will die protecting another Mad Targaryen

He will definitely be for House Stark. That is his redemption

reblog.comment:

summary: I have been brewing some special tea in my kitchen
body:
I have been brewing some special tea in my kitchen

@ all of youse who stan Sansa only now that she is a stone cold ruler displaying predominantly masculine traits but berated her when she was a lonely misled teenager that loved all things feminine but had to face horrific shit and go through countless torture at the age of 14, youre all fake!!!!!

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: Desperado | Show Chapter 27 | Archive of Our Own
title: Desperado | Show Chapter 27 | Archive of Our Own
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
“I miss him,” Rickon said plainly. “I miss Father, too. And Jory.”

Catelyn flinched, as if she were a guitar string that had just been plucked, and her mouth opened to say something doubtless sure to send them all into a spiraling argument.

But then Arya careened back into the dining room, her skirt held up in front to serve as a basket for the collection of items she was toting. As she progressed, one of them flew up and away to flutter to the ground in her wake.

tags: and dimwits wonder why she has a fanbase
summary: i just remembered that sansa went from being locked inside her room to lady of winterfell in the space of what must have been a...
body: i just remembered that sansa went from being locked inside her room to lady of winterfell in the space of what must have been a month. she really went from being tormented by ramsay to executing him within weeks of escaping. she went from watching an old woman’s flayed corpse to having her murderer eaten alive. she went from littlefinger’s pawn to turning everyone against him.

reblog.comment: i just remembered that sansa went from being locked inside her room to lady of winterfell in the space of what must have been a month. she really went from being tormented by ramsay to executing him within weeks of escaping. she went from watching an old woman’s flayed corpse to having her murderer eaten alive. she went from littlefinger’s pawn to turning everyone against him.

summary: i really want book bran to communicate with sansa through a weirwood tree. sansa has been carrying grief for a long time and she...
body: i really want book bran to communicate with sansa through a weirwood tree. sansa has been carrying grief for a long time and she thinks she only has jon left. i can just imagine how emotional she’d get if she heard her little brother and realised he was alive.
